New Records: Boston Celtics set a new NBA record by making 29 3-pointers in a single game
Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 37 points and made eight of the Celtics' 29 3-pointers
Jalen Brunson scored 22 points for New York
Karl-Anthony Towns had just 12 points and seven rebounds
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics raised their NBA-most 18th championship banner to the rafters before the game
The crowd began chanting 'Yankees Suck!' after the Celtics led by more than 20 points early in the third quarter
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics ran away with a 132-109 victory over the New York Knicks on opening night
The new-look Knicks were no match for the team that finished 14 games in front last season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics hit their 29th 3-pointer early in the fourth quarter
The crowd chanted 'One more 3!' in the final minutes
The Celtics visit Washington on Thursday and the Knicks play their home opener against Indiana on Friday
